data.title: Soviet Era Art Private Collection
meta_keywords: wallpapers of oil paint water color
famous artist that paint forest scenes
data.meta_description: This website is dedicated to Soviet Art and Socialist Realism in the 20th century. We feature a large number of Soviet and socialist fine arts and posters as well as applied arts and design of that period. The majestic and diverse Russian paintings always please audiences with their volatility and the perfection of art forms. These feature works, by famous masters of art, always surprise by their unusual approach to work, love for the feelings and sensations of each individual. Perhaps that is why so many Russian artists depicted portraits which combine bright and emotional images and epic calm motive. Our collection counts more than 1000 works from the classical period of the Soviet art painting from the 1930th â till the 1980th year, including, so-called, Soviet impressionism - a socialist realism with a human face. Socialist realism is characterized by the glorified depiction of communist values, such as the emancipation of the proletariat, in a realistic manner. The Soviet painting of this period was included strongly into world art heritage.
data.text:
Photo Biography

Abramyan Artashes Saakovich

Born in 1921 in the city of Alexandropol, Armenia.

A graduate of the School of Fine Arts named after Terlemezyan 1941.

1941-1945 participated in the Great Patriotic War.

Graduated from the Institute of Fine Arts in 1952.

From 1952 participated in regional exhibitions, republican and national.

Since 1956, member of the Painters Union.

From 1980 - Emeritus Painter of Armenia.

In 1967, he received the diploma '' For an excellent work ''

Died in 2003 in Yerevan.

Aiucheev Erkhito Erdineevitch

Born in 1925 in Buryatia.

Known painter of Buryatia.

Master of landscapes and portraits.

Emeritus Painter Buryatia (1983)

The national artist of Buryatia (1992)

Graduated from the Irkutsk Art School (1967)

Member of the Painters Union.

His works are found in museums of Moscow, Ulan-Ude.

Died in 2001.

Akimenko Vitaly Ivanovich

Born in 1928 in Nevinnomyssk (North Caucasus).

The representative of the school of painting of Don.

Master of landscape and genre paintings.

His biography and his artistic destiny are linked to the Don River.

Studied at the School of Fine Arts in Rostov-on-Don (1951).

From 1954 years participates in regional exhibitions.

He traveled a lot in his country and participated in over 15 group and solo exhibitions.

Member of the Union of Artists of the USSR.

Currently works are in museums of Rostov-on-Don,

in Krasnodar, Pyatigorsk and

private collections in Germany, France.

Altaev Serafim Petrovich

1931, Voronezh region.

Peopleâs Artist of the USSR.

Merited cultural worker of the RSFSR.

In 1950â1958 studied in the Moscow Art College

named after Stroganov under P. Korin, S. Gerasimov, N. Maksimov.

Works are kept in the State Historic Museum,

the Museum of the Railroad Transport

and in the other regional Art museums of the former USSR.

Amankozhoev Kubanychbek

Born in 1934 in Kyrgyzstan.

Painter and graphic artist.

Studied at the Ecole des Beaux Arts in Frunze (1949-1954).

Studied at the Institute of Fine Arts named after Surikov in Moscow from 1954 to 1957.

Since 1957 participates in numerous regional and national exhibitions.

Member of the Union of Artists of the USSR since 1966.

Works in Bishkek (Kyrgyzstan).

His work is exhibited in major galleries at Bishkek and in museums in Kyrgyzstan.

His paintings are at the National Museum of Bishkek.

Died in 1987.

Andreev Nikolay Petrovich

Ukrainian painter.

Member of the National Union of artists of Ukraine in Crimea.

Angelin Feofan Georgiyevich

Born in 1910, Donetsk region.

He studied at the Moscow State Academy of Art by V.I. Surikov,

the faculty of graphic arts (1936 â1942),

where A.V. Lentulov and I.E. Grabar, who were his tutors.

He devoted himself to lithography, etching, book illustrations.

He worked as an artist in the Bolshoy Theater.

He had participated in art exhibitions since 1942.

Died in 1984, Moscow.

Anishchenko Nikolay Fedorovich

Born in 1915 in Odessa.

A graduate of the School of Fine Arts in Kharkov.

Professor at the University of Fine Arts of Dnepropetrovsk.

Worked as a theater painter named after Gorkiy in Dnepropetrovsk since 1989.

Member of the Painters' Union.

Died in 2009.

Asanov Salim

Born in 1930 in Kyrgyzstan.

Painter and graphic artist.

Author of paintings on the themes of the Kyrgyz life.

Since 1959 he participates in numerous regional and national exhibitions.

Member of the Union of Artists of Kyrgyzstan.

He works in Bishkek (Kyrgyzstan).

Asatryan Voskan Vladimirovich

Born in 1951 in Yerevan, Armenia.

Graduated from the Institute of Fine Arts in Yerevan.

Worked as a painter in a cinema in Yerevan.

Numerous solo and group exhibitions - in 1975.

From 1984- lives and works in Moscow.

Member of the Painters' Union

His paintings are in private collections in France, USA, Germany.

Ashkaryan Gennady Nersesovich

Born on January 17, 1937 at Karachaevsk.

In 1939 his parents moved to Sukhumi.

Graduated from Tskhinval Art School (1956-61).

Worked as a painter in a theater.

studied at the higher art-industrial school in Leningrad.

Participated in exhibitions since 1961.

Member of the Union of Artists of the USSR.

His works are in the National Picture Gallery of the Republic of Abkhazia, as well as in private collections in Russia and Germany.

Died.

Azizyan Grigor Minasovich

Born in 1923 in Armavir, Armenia.

Worked in Yerevan (Armenia).

A graduate of the Art Institute of Yerevan (1947-1953).

Numerous solo exhibitions - since 1966.

Member of the Painters' Union since 1957.

His works are kept in the museum in Armenia.

In 1985 he was awarded the title ""Honored Artist of the USSR""

People's Artist of Armenia.

Died in 2009

Balakay Vladimir Leonidovich

Born in 1928 in Ukraine.

Worked in Donetsk, Ukraine.

A graduate of the School of Fine Arts in Kiev (1946-1947).

Individual exhibitions - from 1956.

Member of the Union of painters.

Died in 2007.

Bashaev Alya Markelovich

Born in 1932 in Dushanbe (Tajikistan).

A graduate of the Institute of Fine Arts in Tashkent.

Worked in Dushanbe.

Member of the Union of painters.

President of the Union of Painters of Tajikistan.

Died in 1970.

Belkov Yury Sergeevich

Born in 1924 in the Vologda region.

Honored Artist of the RSFSR.

A graduate of the School of Fine Arts in Ivanovo (1953).

Since 1952 - a participant of art exhibitions and

from 1961, a member of the Painters Union.

His works are preserved in the Museums of Fine Arts of Chuvashia.

Belmasov Boris Petrovich

Born in 1940 in the region of Krasnodar.

A graduate of the School of Fine Arts named after Grekov Rostov-on-Don 1960-1964.

Graduated from the Institute of Painting, Sculpture and Architecture named after Ilya Repin in Leningrad.

Works in Rostov-on-Don.

Member of the Painters' Union since 1977.

His works are kept in museums of Russia, Bulgaria, in private collections in many countries of the world.

Kommunar Vasilievich Berkuta

Born in 1926 in the Khmelnitsky region.

A graduate of the School of Fine Arts in Dnepropetrovsk, 1949.

Graduated from the Institute of Fine Arts in Kharkov, 1955.

Since 1955 he has participated in numerous art exhibitions.

Member of the Artists' Union since 1966.

He worked as a professor at the school of Fine Arts in Dnepropetrovsk.

His works are stored in the Art Museum of Dnepropetrovsk, in galleries and private collections in Ukraine and abroad.

Died in 2003 in Dnepropetrovsk.

Bogachev Petr Nikiforovich

Born in 1921 in Alexandorvka, Moscow Province.

Petr Bogachev studied at the Surikov Moscow State Art Institute (1941-1950), where S. Gerasimov and V. Favorskaya were his teachers.

Later on, he has lived and worked in Moscow where he regularly participated in exhibitions since 1950.

He is a master of thematic pictures.

In 1954 he made the Bread panel for the All-Union Agriculture Exhibition, in 1959 the Music & Theater panel for the Culture & Everyday Life exhibition pavilion at the All-Union Exhibition of Economic Achievements.

Petr Bogachevâs works were shown in exhibitions in Berlin (1951) and Warsaw (1955).

The artistâs pictures are in a number of big regional museums, in private collections in Russia and abroad.

Boriskin Mikhail Ivanovich

Born in 1922 in Tambov.

Worked in Astrakhan.

A graduate of the School of Fine Arts Astrakhan (1938-1941).

Numerous solo exhibitions.

Member of the Union of Artists of the USSR.

Deceased

Chermyanin Ivan Aleksandrovich

Born in 1926.

A graduate of the School of Fine Arts from 1947 to 1946 Alma-Ata.

Individual exhibitions in Moscow since 1960.

Worked in the genre of landscape, portrait.

Member of the Painters' Union.

Died in 2002.

Ksenia Shilnikova

1971- was born in Nizhny Novgorod (Russia).

1990- Graduated from theatrical art school in the theatrical decor section.

1993- works in Moscow.

1996 Exhibition of painters group ""6 Â½"" organized by the ""Russian Fund of Culture"" Ivanovo.

1997- Exhibition of paintings as part of the international festival ""Premio Cyprae"" Italy in Naples - Sorrento.

1998- Personal exhibition in Nizhny Novgorod.

1998- Exhibition Group of Painters' "6 Â½ " Plain area - 98 "Kineshma".

1999- Personal exhibition in Nizhny Novgorod Expo Center.

2000- Personal exhibition at the House of Friendship of Peoples in Moscow.

2000- Personal exhibition at the State Gallery of Kineshma.

2001- Exhibition ""Painters of Russia"" organized by the association.

""The Painters Elsewhere"" in France, Toulouse, Avignon.

2002- Personal exhibition in Nizhny Novgorod architecture House.

2002- Personal exhibition in France.

Much of the paintings are in private collections in Russia and Europe.

Domnenko Grigory Stepanovich

Born in 1922 in Poltava, Ukraine.

Talented painter. Master landscape and thematic painting.

1946-1950: Studied at the Art School of Lugansk (Ukraine).

Graduated from the Institute of Fine Arts in Kharkov (1950-1956).

Since 1956 has participated in regional and national exhibitions.

His works are kept in the Art Museum in Lugansk and the private collections in France.

Member of the Union of Artists of Ukraine.

Died in 1976.

Efremenko Nikolay Fedorovich

Born in 1915 in Samara (Russia).

Talented representative of the school of painting of Central Asia.

Painter and graphic artist.

A graduate of the School of Fine Arts in Tashkent (1930-1934).

From 1940 participates in numerous regional and national exhibitions.

1932-1935: Professor of the college in Tashkent

1950-1972: Professor of College of Fine Arts in Frunze

Member of the Union of Artists of Kyrgyzstan.

His works are in many private collections in Russia and abroad.

Died in 1972.

Erlikh Vladimir Isaakovich

Born in 1924 in the Odessa region, Ukraine.

A graduate of the College of Fine Arts 1946-1950 Dnepropetrovsk.

famous Ukrainian painter, portraitist, author of landscapes.

Member of the Painters' Union since 1963.

His works are kept in the Art Museum of Dnepropetrovsk, in the National History Museum of Dnepropetrovsk, and in private collections in Israel, France and England.

Died in 2001.

Ermolin Rem Nikolaevich

Born in 1926 in Leningrad.

Emeritus Painter of the Komi Republic.

National artist of RSFSR.

Winner of the State Prize of the Republic of Komi.

Graduated from the Institute of Painting, Sculpture and Architecture named after Ilya Repin in Leningrad (1954-1960).

since 1962 Member of the Union of Artists of the USSR. From this year, a permanent member of exhibitions in Moscow in the Komi Republic, throughout the USSR and abroad.

1976- Receives degree from the Academy of painters for his portrait on the theme of traditions of Komi people.

Professor at the College of Fine Arts Syktyvkar.

President of the Union of Artists of Syktyvkar.

His works are kept in the USSR Museums and private collections in Moscow, USA, Germany.

Died in 2004.

Ermolina Elena Fedorovna

Born in 1931 in Leningrad.

A graduate of the College of Fine Arts in Leningrad (1949-1951).

individual exhibitions from 1961.

She has worked since 1961 in Syktyvkar.

Member of the Painters' Union since 1964.

Winner of the State Prize of the Republic of Komi.

Died in 2008.

Esin Yevgeny Mikhailovich

Born in 1951.

Graduate of the Institute in Cheboksary.

Worked in Cheboksary, Chuvachia.

Member of the Painters' Union since 1991.

Died in 2010.

Evropina Vera Feodorovna

Born in 1899 in Yalta.

She studied at a college of art of Azerbaijan (Baku) 1925-1927.

In 1940, she participated in art exhibitions.

She taught at the art school in Sukhumi.

Member of the Union of Artists of the USSR.

PEOPLE Artist of the USSR.

Artist Emeritus of Abkhaz ASSR.

She died in the 1970s.

Evtchenko Ivan Petrovitch

Born in 1936 in Kherson region, Ukraine.

Ukrainian painter-monumentalist.

A graduate of the College of Fine Arts of Odessa (1958-1963).

Known for his collective farm themed frescoes.

Design and production of mosaic murals in several Ukrainian cities.

Since 1966 participates in regional and national exhibitions.

Worked in Zaporozhye, Ukraine.

Member of the Union of Artists of Ukraine since 1967.

He received the honorary diploma of the Ministry of Culture of Ukraine.

His works are represented in museums of art in Zaporozhie and Donetsk, in galleries and private collections in Ukraine and abroad.

Died in 2014.

Fakhrutdinov Zainutdin

Born in 1951 in Tashkent, Uzbekistan.

Artist-painter.

A graduate of the School of Fine Arts named after Benkov (1971).

A graduate of the Institute of Theatrical Art named after Alexander Ostrovsky in Tashkent (1974}.

Teaches at the school of Fine Arts named after Benkov.

Member of the Union of Artists.

Lives and works in Tashkent.

Fektistov Vyacheslav Vasilievich

Born in 1937 in Nikopole, Ukraine.

A graduate of the School of Fine Arts named after Benkov in Tashkent (1957).

Graduated from the Institute of Painting, Sculpture and Architecture named after Repin in Leningrad.

1960s worked in Kazakhstan.

Since 1960 has participated in numerous exhibitions.

His works are kept in museums of Ukraine.

Member of the Union of Artists of Ukraine.

Died in 2003.

Filatov Vasili Semenovich

Born in 1920.

Known painter of the school of painting of Don.

He studied in a workshop College of Fine Arts in Rostov-on-Don (1950).

From 1952 he participated in regional exhibitions and in more than a dozen group exhibitions.

A member of the Union of Artists since 1953.

His works presented in the Museum of Rostov-on-Don, Taganrog, Cherkassk, and private collections in Germany, France, Russia.

He participated in the Great Patriotic War.

Died in 1982.

Filonenko Vasily Davidovich

Born in 1929.

Ukrainian painter and graphic.

Studied at the College of Fine Arts in Dnepropetrovsk (1955).

Since 1957 - participates in various exhibitions in Ukraine, throughout the USSR.

Since 1960 - member of the Union of Artists of the USSR.

His works are kept in the Art Museum of Dnepropetrovsk and in many private collections in Germany and France.

Died in 1983.

Flekman David Naftulovich

Born in 1914 in the Odessa region (Ukraine).

Talented representative of the school of painting of Kyrgyzstan.

A graduate of the School of Fine Arts of Odessa (1929-1932).

Graduated from the Institute of Fine Arts in Kiev (1940-1941).

From 1941 worked in Frunze, Kyrgyzstan, taught at school of Fine Arts in Frunze.

From 1943 participates in numerous regional and national exhibitions in Kyrgyzstan.

Member of the Artists' Union since 1946.

In 1964 he was awarded the title ""Honored Artist of Kyrgyzstan"".

His works are in museums in Kyrgyzstan and private collections in France, Germany, Poland and Kyrgyzstan.

Died in 2003.

Fomin Anatoly Nikiforovich

Born in 1925 in Kazakhstan.

A graduate of the School of Fine Arts in Kharkov (1954-1960).

Numerous solo exhibitions in Ukraine.

Member of the Union of Artists of the USSR since 1970.

His works are kept in private collections in the UK, Germany, the United States, France, Russia, Finland, Poland and Scotland.

Died in 2003.

Furtat Yury Alexandrovich

Born in 1924 in Ufa, Bashkortostan.

Graduated from Faculty of Fine Arts of the Institute named after Krupskaya in Ufa.

His works are in museums of Bashkortostan in the Russian and foreign private collections.

Member of the Painters' Union since 1959.

Died in 1996.

Gregori Sergeevich Galkin

Born in 1924 in Kharkov.

Painter-monumentalist and graphics. Author of numerous paintings on historical themes.

Studied at the Institute of Fine Arts in Kharkov (1947-1951).

Since 1951 - participates in various exhibitions Kharkov, Ukraine, throughout the USSR.

1956-1958: Design of several monuments in Kharkov.

Member of the Artists' Union since 1958.

Gertsenok Viktor Andreyevich

Born in 1934 in the region of Zaporozhye, Ukraine.

A graduate of the College of Fine Arts of Odessa (1958).

Member of the Painters' Union since 1964.

Master of landscape and still life.

Solo exhibitions were held in Zaporozhye and Kiev.

His works are presented in the National Art Museum of Ukraine, in museums and private collections.

Gorbatchenko Vladimir Semenovich

Born in 1924 in Dnepropetrovsk, Ukraine.

Graduated from Art School in Dnepropetrovsk (1950).

Member of regional, republican exhibitions since 1951.

Member of the Union of Artists of Ukraine since 1962.

Individual exhibitions took place in Dnepropetrovsk (1961, 1974, 1980, 1985)and Moscow (1980).

Author of landscapes and thematic paintings.

His works are in the Dnepropetrovsk Art Museum and private collections in Ukraine and abroad.

Died in 1987.

Gorbunov Leonty Vladimirovich

Born in 1929 in the village of Semenovka.

In 1956 he graduated from the Frunze art school.

Since 1979, member of the Union of Artists of Kyrgyzstan.

He worked in Osh (Kyrgyzstan).

Participant of republican and international exhibitions.

He worked primarily in watercolor and oil.

Many paintings devoted to southern Kyrgyzstan, which is for him an inexhaustible source of inspiration.

His paintings are in the Kyrgyz National Museum of Fine Arts and in private collections.

People's Artist of Kyrgyzstan.

Died in 2013 on the 85-th year of his life.

Gorbunov Viktor Alekseevich

Born in 1931 in Kostroma.

Worked in Kaliningrad.

Graduated from the Institute of Painting, Sculpture and Architecture named after Ilya Repin in Leningrad (1951-1957).

Since 1960, participated in regional and national exhibitions in Kaliningrad and the USSR.

Member of the Painters' Union".

Gorinov Spartak Petrovich

Born in 1925 in Krasnoyarsk.

Honored Artist of Russia.

Talented representative of the school of painting of Volga.

Graduated from Penza Art School 1946-50.

Professor of Art School of Kuibyshev, 1953-1957.

Member of the Union of Artists of RSFSR.

1960: Expose a painting ""Spring Morning"" in the exhibition of the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics, which is a milestone in his work.

Since 1960 participates in regional exhibitions, republican and national.

Worked in Ulyanovsk.

His works are presented in museums and private collections.

Died in 2010.

Gribok Dmitry Konstantinovich

Born in 1931 in Dnepropetrovsk, Ukraine.

Graduated from the Institute of Painting, Sculpture and Architecture named after Ilya Repin in Leningrad in 1964.

His works are kept in the Art Museum of Dnepropetrovsk, in private collections in many countries of the world.

Member of the Painters' Union.

Grigoryan Masis Gevorkovich

Born in 1929 in Leninakan, Armenia.

Graduated from the Institute of Fine Arts and Theatre in Yerevan 1955-1960.

Member of the Painters' Union.

Individual exhibitions - from 1960.

taught at the Institute of Fine Arts and Theatre Yerevan since 1964.

His works are held in private and public collections around the world. Armenia, Russia, Italy, France, Germany, Poland and USA.

His works were exhibited at the Hermitage.

Gromyko Michael Vsyevolodovitch

Born in Shanghai in 1935.

Member of the Academy of Arts of Uzbekistan.

1951-52 : He studied at the Art College of Sverdlovsk.

A graduate of the Theatre Institute in Tashkent, painting department (1956-1962), where he taught later.

In 1969 he became a member of the Union of Soviet artists in the section ""The posters"".

Since 1962, he worked in the field of political posters.

Gubskiy Ivan Kondratievich

He graduated from the Kharkov Art Institute (1952).

Member of the Union of Artists of the USSR since 1962.

Honored Artist of Ukraine (1997).

He taught at the Art School of Lugansk.

He has participated in national and regional exhibitions art.

Died in 2009.

Gurin Vasily Ivanovich

Born in 1939 in Crimea, Ukraine.

Painter of South School. Author of landscapes and still lifes.

Graduated from the Institute of Fine Arts in Kiev (1965).

From 1970 - permanent member exhibition in Kiev and Ukraine.

His works are kept in the Art Museum of Dnepropetrovsk, at the State Museum of Kherson.

Member of the Union of Artists of Ukraine.

Guros (Paronyan-Ovsepyan) Gurgen Gevorkovich

Born in 1905 in Goris, Armenia.

Worked in Yerevan (Armenia).

Member of the Union of Artists of the USSR.

Honored Artist of Armenia since 1965.

Individual exhibitions - from 1936.

He is known as a master of the Armenian landscape.

1939-1956 - participated in Armenian art exhibitions in Moscow.

Works are in the NGA (Yerevan), in numerous private collections.

Died 1981 in Yerevan.

Ivannikova Svetlana Feodorovna

She was born in 1941 in Voronezh, Russia.

Talented representative of the school of painting of Ukraine.

A graduate of the Art Institute of Kyiv (1966-1973).

Since 1966 participates in regional and national exhibitions.

Lives and works in Lugansk (Ukraine).

Member of the Union of Artists of Ukraine.

Kalinin Vladimir Dmitrievitch

Born in 1936 in the region of Rostov-on-Don.

Graduated from the Art College in Rostov-on-Don (1957-1962).

Graduated from the Institute of Painting, Sculpture and Architecture named after Ilya Repin in Leningrad (1965-1971).

He taught at the Pedagogical University in Rostov in the faculty of arts and graphics since 1972.

Member of the Union of painter of the RSFSR since 1989.

Participating in group and solo exhibitions since 1971.

His works are in the collections of the Rostov Regional Museum of Fine Arts, the Museum in Los Angeles (USA).

Died in 2007.

Karkots Vasily Sergeevich

Born in 1926 in Kazakhstan.

Talented representative of the school of painting of Kazakhstan.

The master of still lifes, landscapes.

Member of the Great Patriotic War.

Graduated from the Art School named after Benkov in Tashkent (Uzbekistan 1947-1952).

Graduated from the Pedagogical Institute in Krasnodar.

1963 Becomes a member of the USSR Union of Painters.

From 1961 years participates in regional and national exhibitions

Since 1975 moved to Ukraine.

He lived and worked in Karelia (1952-1954), Kazakhstan (1954-1975).

Working in Dnepropetrovsk.

His works are in museums and private collections in Ukraine and abroad.

Died in 2005.

Kaydalov Vladimir Elpidiforovich

Born in 1907 in Barnaul.

Soviet painter, graphic artist, illustrator and painter posters.

People's Artist of Uzbekistan.

In 1921-1923, he worked in the studio of A. Nikulin in Barnaul.

In 1927-1930 he studied at the workshop of the Association of Artists of Revolutionary Russia in Leningrad, pupil of E. Cheptsov, Mr. Avilov.

From 1930, he began working as a graphic designer and painter posters.

In 1932, he moved to Tashkent.

Member of the Union of Artists of the USSR.

From 1930 he worked as a graphic artist and book illustrator.

important place in his work have watercolors, lithographs, woodcuts.

He created a series of portraits, landscapes and genre paintings.

Member of the Great Patriotic War.

Died in 1985 in Tashkent.

Khaimov Yakov Markovich

Born in 1914 in Belarus.

One of the prominent representatives of the Moscow Impressionist school.

In 1935, he entered the Surikov Institute, where he studied at I. Grabar, A. OsmÑrkin.

It was close to the artistic circle that included Lentulov A., A. Deineka, S. Gerasimov, G. Ryazhskiy.

During the war he was evacuated to Uzbekistan, where he worked under the direction of Gerasimov.

Since 1946, he has participated in important art exhibitions.

He died in 1991.

Khrapkovsky Yakov Pavlovich

Born in 1919 in Kazakhstan.

Graduated from art college in Frunze (Kyrgyzstan) in 1936.

Member of the Great Patriotic War.

worked as a painter at the theater in Frunze.

Member of the Union of Artists.

Lives in Bishkek (Kyrgyzstan).

Kokachev Vitaly Vasilyevich

Born in 1925 in Syktyvkar Komi Republic.

Veteran of the Great Patriotic War.

He received the Order of the Patriotic War 1st degree and a medal ""For Courage"".

Graduated from Art School in Yaroslavl, 1956.

Since 1958, he lived in Syktyvkar.

Member of the Painters' Union since 1975.

People's Artist of the Republic of Komi (2005).

Honored Worker of the Komi Republic (1996).

Died.

Kokin Mikhail Aleksandrovitch

Born in 1921 in Dnepropetrovsk.

Member of the Great Patriotic War.

graduated from the School of Arts in Dnepropetrovsk (1941).

A graduate of the Institute of Arts in Kiev (1954).

Member of the Union of Artists of the USSR since 1958.

Honored Artist of the USSR (1976).

People's Artist of Ukraine (2001).

His works are kept in the Art Museum of Dnepropetrovsk, in the National History Museum of Dnepropetrovsk, in private collections in many countries of the world.

Died in 2009.

Komendant Yury Sergeevich

Born in 1926 in the Donetsk region.

Graduated from Art School in Dnepropetrovsk (1949).

A graduate of the Art Institute of Kyiv.

participating in collective and personal exhibitions, local and national.

Member of the USSR Union of Artists since 1973.

bright representative of socialist realism school - working in genres such as thematic painting, portrait, landscape, still life.

Solo exhibitions - in Rostov-on-Don (1983) and Donetsk (1990, 1993, 1997).

In 2005 he was awarded the title ""Honored Artist of Ukraine"".

His works are represented in the Museum of Art Donetsk, in private collections in Ukraine and abroad.

Died in 2009.

Konstantinova Irina Kuzminichna

She was born in 1918.

A graduate of the Art Institute in Kharkov.

Worked as a painter of theater in Dnepropetrovsk.

Member of the Union of painters.

Died.

Kormilitsyn Dimitri Pavlovich

Born in 1921 in the Ivanovo region.

A graduate of the School of Fine Arts in Palekh (1936-1941).

Graduated from the Institute of Painting, Sculpture and Architecture named after Ilya Repin in Leningrad (1941-1951).

Member of the Great Patriotic War.

Member of the Union of Artists since 1960.

For a long time was the president of the Union of Artists of Nizhny Novgorod.

He taught at school of Fine Arts 1951-1953).

Since 1952 - a participant of art exhibitions.

In 2002 he was awarded the title ""Honored Artist of Russia"".

Died in 2010.

Koshevoy Viktor Ivanovich

Born in 1924 in Ukraine.

Author of paintings on the theme of nature and the theme of everyday life.

1951-1956: Graduated from Art School in Lugansk (Ukraine).

Since 1957 participates in numerous exhibitions in Ukraine and the USSR.

1960: Becomes a Member of the Union of Artists of Ukraine.

He participated in many art exhibitions.

In 2004, a solo exhibition in Lugansk.

Died in 2006.

Kosnichev Evgeny Nikanorovich

Born in 1929 in the Moscow region.

Talented landscape painter and graphic artist, studied at the Institute of Fine Arts named after Surikov in Moscow (1949-1954).

Since 1960 Becomes member of the Union of Artists of RSFSR.

Currently works are in museums of Russia.

The works are abroad in private collections.

Died.

Kostenko Anatoly Alexandrovich

Born in 1920 in Kherson, Ukraine.

Renowned painter of southern school of painting. Brilliant colorist, master of landscapes and still lifes.

Graduated from the Institute of Fine Arts in Kharkov (1946-1950).

His landscapes painted in the post-impressionism, easily recognizable.

His artistic destiny is linked to Dnepropetrovsk.

From 1960 - participated in regional and national exhibitions.

painter's works are in the Municipal Museum of Dnepropetrovsk, at the State Museum of Kherson.

private collections in France and England.

Member of the Union of Artists of Ukraine.

Died in 1996.

Kostenko Victoria Nikolaevna

She was born in 1927.

Graphic artist.

The painter of Ukraine and Russia.

A graduate of the College of Fine Arts in Sverdlovsk in 1949.

Individual exhibitions - from 1956.

From 1960 he taught at the Art Studio.

Participating in exhibitions since 1953.

His paintings were exhibited at the International Biennial in Paris and Venice.

Solo exhibitions were held in Moscow in 1972, 1977, 1982, 1987.

Artist's paintings are preserved in the State Tretyakov Gallery, the State Russian Museum in art museums of the former USSR, the Russian Art Museum in Minneapolis, the United States, many private museums.

Tyshkevich Gregory Antonovich

Born in 1940 in Donetsk, Ukraine.

Ukrainian painter and graphic artist.

Master of landscapes and genre paintings.

A graduate of the Institute of Painting in Kharkov (1958-1963).

Worked in Donetsk, Ukraine.

From 1963 participates in regional and national exhibitions.

Member of the Union of Artists of Ukraine.

Tyurin Viktor Stepanovich

Born in 1917 in Bashkiria.

Talented representative of the school of painting of Kyrgyzstan.

Graduated from Art College named after ""1905"" in Moscow (1936-1940).

Member of the Great Patriotic War.

After the war, he entered the Moscow Art Institute named after Surikov (1945-1951).

1963 Moscow - Exhibits a painting ""Meeting of Russian emigrants"" which is a milestone in his work.

He particularly likes drawing the Kirghiz steppe with yurts, with shepherds with flocks of sheep, all which expresses the beauty of Kyrgyzstan.

in 1967 received the honorary title of Emeritus Painter of Kyrgyzstan.

For a long time was the president of the Union of Artists of Kyrgyzstan.

Works are in the National Museum of Fine Arts named after Aytiev, Bishkek.

Died in 2008.

Usubaliev Altymysh

Born December 12, 1930.

Graduated from the Institute of Painting, Sculpture and Architecture named after Ilya Repin in Leningrad (1953).

he taught at the school of painting named after Chuikov in Kyrgyzstan (1953-1970).

Participation in exhibitions since 1948.

Member of the Union of Artists since 1956.

Creates a huge gallery of portraits of personalities of culture, science and art of Kyrgyzstan.

Almost all of the artist's portraits are in the Aitiev National Museum and the Oriental Art Museum (Moscow).

Died in 1971.

Vartanyan Gervasy Alekseevich

Born in 1927 in the city of Vanadzor, Armenia.

Graduated from art school named after Terlemezyan. 1950.

Graduated from the Institute of Painting and Theatre in Yerevan, 1956.

Since 1956, he participated in art exhibitions.

Since 1957 - member of the Union of Artists of Armenia.

Honored Artist of the Armenian SSR.

Works are in private collections in Germany, France, the United States.

Verigo Anatoly Konstantinovich

Born in 1922 in Odessa.

Member of the Union of Artists of the USSR.

He worked in the studio Grekov as painter 1944-1946

He studied at the Institute of Fine Arts named after Surikov in Moscow 1950 - 1956.

Diploma work - a series of ""Muscovites in the summer Sunday,"" Professor E. A. Kibrik.

Exhibitions since 1945.

The personal exhibition was held in 1964 in Moscow.

From 1958 to 1982 he taught at the Faculty of Fine Arts of the Textile Institute.

Many of his works are in museums of Novosibirsk, Kazan, Moscow.

The works are abroad in private collections (America, Germany, France).

Died in 2001 in Moscow.

Yakushev Pavel Petrovich

Born in 1914 in the city of Zlatoust.

Graphic artist, decorator.

He studied at Art College in Moscow, 1930 - 1933.

Since 1952 - in Kuibyshev (Samara).

Talented representative of the school of painting of Volga.

Emeritus Painter of RSFSR.

In 1938 became a member of the Union of Artists of RSFSR.

He taught at Art College in Kuibyshev, 1951-1957.

1962: President of the Union of Painters of Kuibyshev.

His works are found in many museums in Russia and abroad, in private collections.

Died.

Yusupov Khasboulat

Born in 1940.

Graduated from Art College named after Benkov in Tashkent.

Individual exhibitions - from 1958.

Works in the genre of landscape, portrait.

Member of the Painters' Union".

Zagorodnyuk Fedor Ivanovich

Born in 1922 in Vinnitsa region.

Graduated from art school in Kherson, 1941.

A graduate of the Kiev Institute of Painting in 1950.

Individual exhibitions - from 1950.

Member of the Union of Artists of the USSR since 1978.

Zalitko Viktor Grigorievich

Born in 1939 in the Urals.

Talented painter of the North of Russia (Komi Republic).

A graduate of Perm Art College (1957-1962).

Lives and works in Syktyvkar (Komi Republic).

From 1965 participated in group and solo exhibitions.

Member of the Union of painters.

His works are in museums in many cities of the Komi Republic and in private collections.

Zavatsky Viktor Vladimirovich

Born in 1932 in the region of Kharkov, Ukraine.

Graduated from Art College in Pensa, 1948- 52.

Individual exhibitions - from 1955.

Member of the Painters' Union.

Died in 2008.

Zhezher Anatoly Mikhaylovich

Born in 1937, Dnepropetrovsk Region.

Graduated from Art College in Dnepropetrovsk (1955-1961).

Numerous solo exhibitions in Ukraine.

Member of the Union of Artists since 1978.

Works are in the museums of Dnepropetrovsk and in private collections in Ukraine, Europe.

Zhuravlev Oleg Vitalievitch

Born in 1981 in Furmanov.

Studied at the Institute of Fine Arts named after Surikov in Moscow.

President of Art Club ""Tradition"".

Vice President of the Russian Association of marine painters.

Member of the Russian Union of Artists.

Member of the Russian Geographical Society.

Lives and works in Moscow.

Zorko Yuri Valentinovich

Born in 1937 in the village of Razdolnoe Primorsky Krai (Russia).

Honored Artist of Ukraine.

Graduated from Art College in Donetsk, (1962-1966).

Winner of the State Prize of Ukraine. Author of landscapes.

In 1972 became Member of the Union of Artists of the USSR.

taught at the college of art in Donetsk.

His works are preserved in the Museums of Art of Ukraine, in private collections in many countries.

In 2003 he received the title - ""People's Artist of Ukraine"".

Rosalia Rabinovich

Born in 1895 in Kiev.

Painter, graphic artist, set designer, painter.

Member of the Union of Artists of the USSR.

Studied: 1912-16 Studio A.A.Murashko (Kiev).

1918-19 in the Studio Decorative Art (Kiev) A.A.Ekster.

Since the end of 1919 lived in Moscow.

She studied in the studio A.A.Osmerkina, D.A.Scherbinovskogo in the Higher Art (1920-25).

Since 1925 - participant of exhibitions.

From 1929 she worked in a factory hand painted fabrics.

She made the posters, industrial design.

From 1933 she taught in theatrical design sector in the Central House of artistic education of children to them Bubnov.

1939 - Decorator of several performances.

1940-43 - she worked in the brigade theater artists (Ashgabat).

Works are in many museum collections, including the State Tretyakov Gallery, the Pushkin Museum, Karakalpak State Museum of Arts Savitsky in Nukus.

Died in 1988 in Moscow.
